title: 20mph: Labour hopeful Vaughan Gething promises public say
description: The public should be able to take part in a review of the controversial 20mph speed limit policy, a Welsh Labour leadership candidate has said. Vaughan Gething said the public needed to have the chance to comment on the exercise.

title: The latest on Israel's war in Gaza
description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said "nobody will stop us" from destroying Hamas as the war in Gaza passed the 100-day mark. Follow live updates.

title: Reform Sets Up Tory Defections Unit
description: Right wing party Reform UK has set up a new unit focused on handling potential defections to its ranks as it tries to lure

title: The Tories have failed on everything – fixing potholes is all they have left
description: In chess, they call it zugzwang. Any legal move that the Tories make now will only drastically worsen their already wretched position.

title: ‘I was the white girl who’d been taken in hook, line and sinker’: the Britons who survived a Nigerian cult
description: Two British women became prisoners at the Synagogue Church of All Nations, run by the evangelical Nigerian pastor TB Joshua

title: Jamaican poet Jason Allen-Paisant win TS Eliot Prize for ‘theatrical’ poetry
description: Jason Allen-Paisant has won the TS Eliot Prize for his poetry collection Self-Portrait As Othello, which has been praised for its “nerve, style and integrity”. The collection won the prestigious prize out of 186 poetry collections submitted by British and Irish publishers.

title: The West must win this battle with the enemy within
description: On Saturday, though, there was a new chant: “Yemen, Yemen, make us proud, turn another ship around” – a reference to the Houthis’ attacks on shipping in the Red Sea, and the US and UK military ... The rise of identity politics has transformed ...

title: In pictures: US and Canada blanketed by frigid air
description: More than 142 million people across the US are under a wind chill alert on Monday, as frigid Arctic air hangs over much of the country. The National Weather Service (NWS) said the heartland of the US will likely experience record-breaking cold. Temperatures in Montana are forecast to plunge below -50F (-45C).

title: Foreign aid could be the key to Tory election wipeout
description: Rishi Sunak’s announcement in Ukraine last week of £2.5bn aid for the coming year would take the total UK support to Kyiv to more than £7bn, Shapps said. Confirming the end of the “peace dividend” enjoyed by the West since the end of the Cold War,

title: Migrants see Britain as 'El Dorado', French warn amid boats crisis
description: The mayor of the French town where five asylum seekers died on Sunday blamed Britain's benefits system for thousands to cross the Channel.

title: I am determined to pass Rwanda bill, says Rishi Sunak
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has said he is "determined" to get his Safety of Rwanda Bill into law, despite criticism from his own backbenchers. More than 50 Conservative MPs have backed amendments they say would toughen up the bill, which returns to the House of Commons on Tuesday.

title: Scottish asylum hotels are a gift for the far right
description: WE’RE back in Rwanda fantasy-land today. The Tory immigration bill returns to Parliament. It faces the ire of Conservative rebels who claim

title: Geopolitical tensions and AI dominate start of World Economic Forum
description: Ukraine, Middle East and Taiwan overshadow annual meeting at Davos, with artificial intelligence also high on agenda

title: Is YOUR MP about to be kicked out? Interactive map based on major new poll shows how Keir Starmer is on track to turn the country red at the election - as Rishi Sunak tries to ...
description: Rishi Sunak insisted he has a 'plan' after a huge survey of 14,000 voters found the Conservatives are on course to lose nearly 200 seats at this year's general election.

title: Baroness Lawrence says 'racism' is to blame for Windrush scandal as new campaign for justice begins
description: The Windrush scandal emerged in 2018. Justice4Windrush is calling for justice after 15,000 people were wrongly classified as illegal immigrants. | ITV News London

title: Sam Coates: Tories may well face disaster - but this mysterious election poll is designed to cause trouble
description: Don't get distracted by questions over the mystery funder, or the linked but separate disputed analysis over the impact on the Tory vote of Reform UK.

title: Migrants taken off first Rwanda flight still in asylum hotels after 589 days
description: First 47 asylum seekers selected for deportation still waiting for claims to be decided and say they are being ‘punished’

title: Shapps makes case for increased western defence spending in ‘pre-war’ era
description: By David Hughes, PA Political Editor The UK is facing a “pre-war world” and the “peace dividend” that allowed successive governments to ease spending on defence is over, Grant Shapps has said. Before taking the role,

title: Is it safe to travel to Egypt? Latest travel advice
description: The Foreign Office has updated its advice to the popular holiday destination, which has conflict zones to the north and south

title: UK Covid Inquiry comes to Scotland
description: Despite their faults, SNP was serious about tackling Covid – unlike No10 I remember back in the early days of the Covid pandemic

title: ‘Patience running out with Northern Ireland’ – Naomi Long
description: The Alliance Party leader has warned that patience with Northern Ireland is “running out” in London as she urged the DUP to return to devolved government. The Stormont Assembly has been effectively collapsed for almost two years while the DUP refuses to take part while unionist concerns on post-Brexit trading arrangements remain.

title: English Tory politicians running Facebook groups opposing 20mph in Wales while supporting it where they live
description: A Conservative councillor from Sunderland with no apparent links to Wales is running multiple Facebook groups opposing the 20mph limit here despite apparently supporting the limit in his hometown. A WalesOnline investigation has shown that the administrators of these social media groups have direct links to the Conservative Party.

title: Tory leader in York accuses Lib Dems of scoring 'cheap political points' over free school meals
description: The Conservative group leader on the City of York Council has accused the Liberal Democrats of trying to score “cheap political points” over Labour’s free school meal policy.

title: YouGov poll predicts Lib Dem victory in Harrogate and Knaresborough
description: The Liberal Democrats are on course to gain Harrogate and Knaresborough from the Conservatives, according to the latest YouGov / MRP poll.

title: Sunak plays down dire poll figures amid warnings of election wipeout
description: A major opinion poll indicated Labour could be on course for a 120-seat majority in the election expected later this year.

title: Reform UK: the party frightening the Tories from the fringes
description: The rightwing populist party and successor to Ukip has Conservative voters in its sights. Ben Quinn reports

title: Tory MPs told to ignore dire polling amid warnings of election wipeout
description: Tory MPs have been told by the party’s elections guru to ignore dire polling aimed at “undermining this Government” and warned that “divided parties fail”.

title: Anthony Joshua and Francis Ngannou face off for first time ahead of heavyweight fight
description: Joshua and Ngannou fight in Saudi Arabia in March to close out Riyadh season and they faced off for the first time at a press conference in London

title: ‘Patience running out with Northern Ireland’ – Naomi Long
description: Alliance Party leader Naomi Long (left) with party colleague Andrew Muir (2nd left) speak to representatives from teachers unions as they protest outside Hillsborough Castle, before meeting Northern Ireland Secretary Chris Heaton-Harris as he meets political parties over the Stormont stalemate (Liam McBurney/PA) The Stormont Assembly has been effectively collapsed for almost two years while the DUP refuses to take part while unionist concerns on post-Brexit trading arrangements remain.

title: Covid bereaved group demand 'truth' about early lockdown from Scottish and UK Government
description: A Covid bereaved group has called on the Scottish and UK governments to tell the “truth” about the early days of the Covid lockdown in Scotland, ahead of the UK Covid Inquiry resuming north of the border. The UK Covid-19 I nquiry resumes on Tuesday with hearings in Edinburgh over the next three weeks.

title: Rishi Sunak: Strikes on Houthis intended as 'limited, single action'
description: But the prime minister says the UK "will not hesitate to protect our security" following Houthi attacks on shipping.

title: Migrants taken off first Rwanda flight still in asylum hotels after 589 days
description: First 47 asylum seekers selected for deportation still waiting for claims to be decided and say they are being ‘punished’

title: Six ways inequality holds back climate action
description: With the ability to successfully lobby against climate policies, the super-wealthy have no compulsion to curb their highly polluting behaviour. For example, private jet travel remains legal despite it being the most polluting transport mode of all and useful to just a tiny minority.

title: The global becomes home
description: Studying for her MA Gender & Development, Faith Chiazor shares with us her experience of moving from Nigeria to the UK to study, and how she has settled into life at IDS. Discovering IDS Family, they say,

title: ‘Hard to see any barriers for Stormont getting back to work’ – Heaton-Harris
description: The Secretary of State said he will introduce new primary legislation at Westminster next week if devolved government has not been restored.

title: Conservatives face 1997-style electoral wipeout, major poll suggests
description: The Conservatives are facing a 1997-style electoral wipeout that would hand Labour a 120-seat majority, a major opinion poll suggests. A YouGov survey of 14,000 people indicates that Rishi Sunak’s Tories could hold on to as few as 169 seats as Sir Keir Starmer’s Labour enters Downing Street with 385.
